Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma's team will be looking to top Group A with another victory in Dubai.
India will remember how close Hong Kong came to pulling off an incredible upset the last time these sides met.
Hong Kong's cricket structure is smaller than what you would find even in a tier-2 city in India.
India had optional nets on the eve of the game, mindful of the heat and giving their senior players a break.
Hong Kong have preferred to train at night.
Hong Kong's coach Trent Johnston knows a thing or two about orchestrating upsets - Pakistan in Jamaica (2007), England in Bengaluru (2011).
India WWWLW (last five completed matches; most recent first)
All eyes were on Rishabh Pant at training on Tuesday evening, and he was smashing balls hard and far.
Hong Kong captain Nizakat Khan came close to scoring a century against India four years ago.
Nizakat Khan has been in good form, hitting a century against Jersey in a third-round clash of the ICC Challenger League B just three weeks ago.
In the Asia Cup qualifiers in Oman, Nizakat Khan anchored a chase against Kuwait with a half-century.
India have spoken about their willingness to experiment.

India (probable): 1 Rohit Sharma (capt), 2 KL Rahul, 3 Virat Kohli, 4 Rishabh Pant (wk), 5 Deepak Hooda, 6 Hardik Pandya, 7 Dinesh Karthik, 8 R Ashwin, 9 Avesh Khan, 10 Ravi Bishnoi, 11 Arshdeep Singh

Hong Kong (probable): 1 Nizakat Khan (capt), 2 Babar Hayat, 3 Yasim Murtaza, 4 Kinchit Shah, 5 Scott McKechnie (wk), 6 Haroon Arshad, 7 Aizaz Khan, 8 Zeeshan Ali, 9 Ehsan Khan, 10 Ayush Shukla, 11 Mohammad Ghazanfar
Miscellaneous Highlights: A fresh, hard surface will be used for Wednesday's game and that should mean bounce for the bowlers.
The absence of dew in Dubai has reduced the difficulty of bowling second.
Extreme heat caused delays and brought the over-rate penalty into play in both innings of the India-Pakistan game.
KL Rahul has an impressive T20 record in Dubai - 731 runs in 16 innings at a strike rate of 147.67, including one century and six half-centuries.
Offspinner Ehsan Khan was Hong Kong's leading wicket-taker in the Asia Cup qualifiers, picking up nine wickets in three games.
In Hong Kong's previous game against India in 2018, Ehsan dismissed both Rohit and MS Dhoni.
